overview: From 2025-11-01 to 2025-12-01, ethereum-optimism/docs had 43 new PRs (44 merged), 2 new issues, and 60 active contributors.

topIssues.title: [DA Footprint Limit] Documentation
topIssues.author: geoknee
topIssues.body:
* Should emphasize the risks around setting the scalar 
  - too high (excludes too much traffic)
  - too low (ineffective at protecting against spam or DA backlogs, throttling becomes likely)
* When Gas Limit is changed, this scalar should also be changed 

---
https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/design-docs/pull/317 WIP design doc
https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/specs/pull/767 WIP specs
https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVJIlXd1Q=/ threat modelling

topIssues.title: [DOCS] Begin documenting `MinBaseFee` feature
topIssues.author: geoknee
topIssues.body:
<!-- please fill out the description and acceptance criteria to the best to your ability. While the other sections are optional, it makes resolving the issue much easier. -->

## Description 
<!-- Write a clear and concise description of the docs request. For example, is the request related to an existing page or are you suggesting a brand-new docs page? -->
We would like to start work documenting this feature currently in development: 



## Acceptance criteria
<!-- Clearly list out the definition of done. -->
*  Chain Operators need to be made aware that setting the minimum too high may have negative impacts on users (making transactions harder to get included). 
* Chain operators need to understand the manner by the parameter is set using a base 2 logarithm. 

## User stories
<!-- User stories that illustrate the benefits of this issue. For example, this documentation improvement will allow user X to be able to Y. -->


## Resources and support
<!-- Provide additional documentation, context, and subject matter experts to help us complete this issue. -->
https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/design-docs/pull/295
SME: @geoknee, @joshklop , @sebastianst 

## Action items
<!-- Clear steps to take to complete this issue -->

topIssues.title: Update consensus layer and execution config
topIssues.author: bradleycamacho
topIssues.body:
## Description

https://docs.optimism.io/operators/node-operators/configuration/execution-config
https://docs.optimism.io/operators/node-operators/configuration/consensus-config

Simplify naming, logically group the configurations, put in a recommended configuration, and provide some more context on the important configuration files.

## Action items

1. Do research on topic and raise any questions with the docs team
2. Write a first draft. It doesn't have to be worded perfectly as the docs team will review
3. Ping @bradleycamacho or @krofax on discord and request review
4. Implement feedbacks from @bradleycamacho and @krofax
5. Publish

topPRs.title: Add Actions SDK Reference Pages
topPRs.author: its-everdred
topPRs.body:
## Problem

At the moment, we only have a Quickstart guide for Actions SDK. We need additional detail.

## Solution

- [x] Add Configuring Actions Doc
- [x] Add Integrating Wallets Doc
- [x] Add Wallet API Doc
- [x] Add Lend API Doc
- [x] Add actions-sdk as a devDependency and script to generate doc components from inline docs
- [ ] Clean up script

topContributors.summary: devin-ai-integration: Focused on improving the quality and clarity of documentation and contract specifications for the Ethereum Optimism project. They made several impactful enhancements to the specifications, most notably by linking defined terms to their definitions in a large refactor (`specs#856`, +274/-225 lines), adding a new `SuperFaultDisputeGame` variant (`specs#852`), and cleaning up existing contract specs (`specs#853`, `specs#854`). This was complemented by a broad effort across 12 separate pull requests to fix typos and grammatical errors throughout the `ethereum-optimism/docs` repository, demonstrating a clear focus on improving overall documentation and specification quality.

sbvegan: Focused on critical documentation and registry updates, merging 12 PRs to support network communications and upgrades. They executed a major update to notice pages for communications in `ethereum-optimism/docs#1847` (+2155/-698 lines) and managed key details for the Jovian hard fork, including updating release information in `ethereum-optimism/docs#1852`. In addition to these direct contributions, sbvegan was an active collaborator, providing 25 code reviews. This work shows a primary focus on maintaining and improving project documentation.
